cleaned_text: How do I take a high dose when most supplements come in 50mg caps and I read that allithiamine is better than regular thiamine and is more beneficial for PWPs because it crosses the brain blood barrier. I need some advice. I've been taking three hundred mg daily but need to increase without taking handfuls of the supplements every day. Thanks High dose thiamine?: How do I take a high... - Cure Parkinson's High dose thiamine? This is a good place to start: The Parkinson's B1 Therapy FB group [facebook.com/groups/parkins...](/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fgroups%2Fparkinsonsb1therapy) This may help : [healthunlocked.com/cure-par...](https://healthunlocked.com/cure-parkinsons/posts/144405745/updated-dosing-information-on-hdt-b1-thiamine-hcl-hci-for-new-members-considering-hdt-including-a-link-to-all-of-dr.-costantinis-info) Art The originators of the high-dose thiamine protocol specify thiamine HCL is the version to take: [vitacost.com/vitacost-vitam...](/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vitacost.com%2Fvitacost-vitamin-b-1) [park_bear](/user/park_bear) I assume they may have specified thiamine HCL bc not all forms of B1 are water soluble and then a high dose could be dangerous. Since covid the large dose supplement is not available. I guess it is a handful. Sounds as if you haven't got my book!
